column2: Gini coefficient (after tax)
column6: The Gini coefficient is a measure of the inequality of the income distribution in a population. Higher values indicate a higher level of inequality. Income here is measured after taxes and benefits.

column2: Income share of the richest 10% (after tax)
column6: The share of income received by the richest 10% of the population. Income here is measured after taxes and benefits.

column6: The share of income received by the richest 1% of the population. Income here is measured after taxes and benefits.

column6: The share of income received by the poorest 50% of the population. Income here is measured after taxes and benefits.

column2: Palma ratio (after tax)
column6: The share of income of the richest 10% divided by the share of the poorest 40%. Income here is measured after taxes and benefits.

Gini coefficient (after tax)
column5:
The Gini coefficient is a measure of the inequality of the income distribution in a population. Higher values indicate a higher level of inequality.

This is post-tax national income. Income here is measured after taxes and benefits.

column2: Income share of the richest 10% (after tax)
column5:
This is the income of the richest 10% as a share of total income.

This is post-tax national income. Income here is measured after taxes and benefits.

column5:
This is the income of the richest 1% as a share of total income.

This is post-tax national income. Income here is measured after taxes and benefits.

column2: Income share of the poorest 50% (after tax)

This is the income of the poorest 50% as a share of total income.

column2: Palma ratio (after tax)
column5:
The Palma ratio is a measure of inequality: it is the share of total income of the top 10% divided by the share of the bottom 40%.

This is post-tax national income. Income here is measured after taxes and benefits.

column2: Gini coefficient (before tax)
column5:
The Gini coefficient is a measure of the inequality of the income distribution in a population. Higher values indicate a higher level of inequality.

This is pretax national income. Income here is measured before taxes and benefits. Income is measured before payment of taxes and non-pension benefits, but after the payment of public and private pensions.

column5:
This is the income of the richest 10% as a share of total income.
